variation.name: 291.01 Two label linkbases with no overrides combine
variation.description: 291.01 The two disjoint label linkbases of a schema together combine into a single PTVL.

variation.name: A label linkbase arc overrides another
variation.description: 291.02One label linkbase overrides another label linkbase.

variation.name: A label linkbase arc overrides another and inserts a substitute arc between the same concept and label
variation.description: 291.03 One label linkbase prohibits a link in another linkbase and link again. But use attribute must be prohibited so the second override must not be permitted.

variation.name: Two definition linkbases with no overrides combine
variation.description: 291.04 The two disjoint definition linkbases of a schema together combine into a single PTVL.

variation.name: A definition linkbase arc overrides another
variation.description: 291.05 One Linkbase prohibits one link in another linkbase.

variation.name: A definition linkbase arc overrides another and inserts a substitute arc between the same two concepts
variation.description: 291.06 One Linkbase prohibits and another Linkbase links againt the link in other linkbase.

variation.name: A label linkbase arc overrides with no prohibited value.
variation.description: 291.07 One label linkbase overrides another label linkbase. But overriding labelArc element's use attribute value is "optional". That's why this must be invalid.

variation.name: A label linkbase arc overrides from an item to another item
variation.description: 291.08 One label linkbase overrides another label linkbase. But overriding labelArc element have from and to attribute which both points to item in a schema.That's why this must be invalid.

variation.name: A label linkbase arc overrides but different role labelLink
variation.description: 291.09 One label linkbase overrides another label linkbase. But overriding labelLink has different role. There seems to have no special usecase for this. But it is no problem from the Specificaiton point of view. That's why this must be valid and ignored or warned.

variation.name: Two reference linkbases with no overrides combine
variation.description: 291.10 The two disjoint reference linkbases of a schema together combine into a single PTVL.

variation.name: A reference linkbase arc overrides another
variation.description: 291.11 One reference linkbase overrides another reference linkbase.

variation.name: A reference linkbase arc overrides another and inserts a substitute arc between the same concept and reference
variation.description: 291.12 One reference linkbase prohibits a link in another linkbase and link again. But use attribute must be prohibited so the second override must not be permitted.

variation.name: A reference linkbase arc overrides with no prohibited value.
variation.description: 291.13 One reference linkbase overrides another reference linkbase. But overriding referenceArc element's use attribute value is "optional". That's why this must be invalid.

variation.name: A reference linkbase arc overrides from an item to another item
variation.description: 291.14 One reference linkbase overrides another reference linkbase. But overriding referenceArc element have from and to attribute which both points to item in a schema.That's why this must be invalid.

variation.name: A reference linkbase arc overrides but different role referenceLink
variation.description: 291.15 One reference linkbase overrides another reference linkbase. But overriding referenceLink has different role. There seems to have no special usecase for this. But it is no problem from the Specificaiton point of view. That's why this must be valid and ignored or warned.
